The video was shared on social media pla: including Facebook, with claims that protesters were being paid to agitate against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA).
The video received a high number of shar: with some individuals calling for violence against the protestors and using derogatory language targeting the Muslim community.
An article by Asianet News claimed that: Delhi, were distributing money to women.
Chennai: based activist Chandra Mohan debunked the social media claims by recording a video at the same location mentioned in the viral video. He introduced a man named Shahzad Malik, who was seen distributing cash in the video, and explained that Malik provided ration to victims instead of paying them to protest.
